pulp.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a very soft substance that is almost liquid, made by crushing plants, wood, vegetables etc
pulp.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Mash the bananas to a pulp.
timber grown for wood pulp (=used for making paper)
a soft pulp of leaves and mud
pulp.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the soft inside part of a fruit or vegetable
pulp.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Halve the melon and scoop out the pulp.
pulp.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: books, magazines, films etc that are badly written and that contain lots of sex, violence etc
pulp.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: an ad in a pulp magazine
pulp.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: part of the inside of a tooth
pulp.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to beat or crush something until it becomes very soft and almost liquid
pulp.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to beat or hit someoneâ€™s face or body very badly
pulp.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: His body was pulped by the impact of the train.
pulp.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to make wood or old books and newspapers into paper
pulp.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Unsold novels are sent to be pulped.
pulp.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a British group, popular in the 1990s, whose music was an example of Britpop, and whose singer was Jarvis Cocker
